chargeHist.descr: Injury by Use of Vehicle with PAC
Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC>=0.15) and Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15). The defendant was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC>=0.15) and the other charge, Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15) was dismissed by the court.

  • Gerald C Pophal was found guilty of Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).
  • Gerald C Pophal was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC>=0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.
  • Gerald C Pophal was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC>=0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  AODA/treatment per agent.  Absolute Sobriety.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 19, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Gerald C Pophal in court with attorney Phillip J. Violi and Gary A Miller.  Rick C Spoentgen and Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes State's motion in limine re: expert Peterson and motion re: pre-accident witnesses are what is set to be addressed today.  Atty Albrecht agrees that is what is it to be addressed/notes Daubert hearing is set for a week from today to address that motion.  Atty Miller states he thought they were just going to do the three vehicles today.  Court takes up Peterson motion first.  Atty Albrecht notes they have received only a paltry description of what the testimony will be.  971.23(2m)(am) is the legal basis for State's motion re: Peterson.  Atty Miller responds re: computer animation.  Atty Albrecht objects as to foundation comments by Atty Miller.  Court questions parties re: dates documents were received.  Parties argue relevance of testimony as it hasn't been provided yet.  State feels it should be excluded as it's untimely.  Atty Miller responds.  State requests date certain set if the Court will not exclude the witness.  Atty Miller responds/will be meeting w/witness on Friday and could find out then.  Court suggests he get two views from the witness when he meets w/him re: when he can provide the animation in question.  Court advises Atty Miller that if he feels he needs more time for trial he should file a motion.  Court denies the State's motion re: testimony of Peterson at this time.  Any animation to be used during trial to be disclosed to the State not less than 48 hours prior to trial.  Court states other motion to be addressed re: vehicles who witnessed accident.  Atty Miller makes statement re: vehicles and where they were when they passed the DE's vehicle.  Atty Spoentgen responds re: statements provided.  Court questions parties re: which vehicles are in question.  Atty Miller notes pictures on State's monitor he has not yet received.  Atty Miller will go back and check his CD's to make sure he doesn't have them.  Court advises Atty Miller to let DA know tomorrow if he needs those photos still.  Court excludes testimony of the Coppernoll's as it goes to the State's case in chief.  Will reserve decision later re: possible rebuttal testimony.  Atty Miller addresses three ladies also being called.  Atty Spoentgen responds/they can testify as they were in the vehicle which is the subject of count 9.  Court will permit the testimony of the three ladies.  Recess for today.
of Intended Use of Medical Records at Trial
Motion hearing on January 12, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on January 4, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on November 30, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Gerald C Pophal in court with attorney Gary A. Miller and Phil V. as co-counsel.  Michael X. Albrecht and Rick Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to strike four counts of the second amended information, motion to dismiss four counts of the second amended information and motion challenging admissability of certain evidence listed in the motion in limine.  State recites offer to DE.  Atty Miller objects to offer.  Court questions DE on offer.  DE rejects offer.  State calls Dr. Donald A. Wiebe - S&T.  Ex. 1 offered.  5th or 6th sample drawn comment is stricken.  Atty Miller cross-exams.  Back on record at 10:33.  Redirect from State.  Recross from Atty Miller.  State requests Ex. 1 be admitted into evidence.  Atty. Miller objects.  State requests Dr. be released from Subpoena.  Atty. Miller does not object.  Ex. 1 received.  Court denies the motion in limine regarding lab tests.  State calls Lorrine Edwards - S&T.  Atty Miller cross exams.  Redirect from State.  Recross from Atty. Miller.  State requests Ms. Edwards be released from Subpoena.  Atty Miller does not object.  Recess at 12:18.  Back on the record at 1:25 p.m.  Atty Miller states factors of Daubert motion.  State states their position of same.  Court denies the motion in limine regarding Daubert.  Recess at 1:53.  Back on record at 2:09.  Recess at 2:11.  Back on the record at 3:00 p.m.  State advises counts 6 & 7 can be struck from second amended information.  Court grants the motion as to counts 6 & 7 of the second amended information.  Court denies the motion as to count 8 of the second amended information.   Court grants leave to amend the information.  Court denies the motion as to count 9 of the second amended information.  DE stands mute.  Court enters not guilty pleas on counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8 & 9.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Motion hearing on November 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
from ADA Albrecht re: 1/23 thru 1/27 court dates

Defendant Gerald C Pophal in court with attorney Gary A. Miller.  Rick C Spoentgen and Mike Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requesting reset due to witness not being available for trial.  Atty. Miller states may resolve one issue regarding amended information and DE's motion in limine regarding blood draw.  Relies on assumption that cannot be proven by discovery.  Cannot render an opinion on scientific certainty.  2 charges in complaint that have to do with blood alcohol. No amended information filed yet.  State intends to file amended information if Court grants reset request.  Court states has not seen any emails or reports.  Court not granting or denying any motions right now.  Atty. Miller objects to reset.  State states has no control on primary witness having surgery.  Court grants request for continuance.  Court states this case was not set for trial before.  Set up new scheduling order.  State files amended information now.  Court grants leave to amend the information.
Atty Miller acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and enters NG plea.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continues.  Bond continued.
